articles.author: Nathan Layne, James Oliphant, Gram Slattery
articles.description: Donald Trump's vice presidential running mate, U.S. Senator J.D. Vance, addresses the Republican National Convention on Wednesday in a speech that could illustrate how Trump's "Make America Great Again" movement may dominate the party for years to come.
articles.title: Rising Republican star J.D. Vance to take spotlight ahead of Trump, as Biden contracts COVID

articles.author: Maria Martinez, Holger Hansen
articles.description: Germany plans to halve its military aid to Ukraine next year, despite concerns that U.S. support for Kyiv could potentially diminish if Republican candidate Donald Trump returns to the White House.
articles.title: Germany to halve military aid for Ukraine despite possible Trump White House

articles.author: Mark Trevelyan
articles.description: Four decades ago, the United States deployed cruise and Pershing II nuclear missiles in Europe to counter Soviet SS-20s - a move that stoked Cold War tensions but led within years to a historic disarmament deal.
articles.title: How dangerous is the new US-Russia missile race?

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces pounded areas in the central Gaza Strip on Wednesday, killing at least nine Palestinians, according to health officials, while Israeli tanks carried out a limited advance further into Rafah in the south.
articles.title: Israel pounds central Gaza, sends tanks into north of Rafah

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A car drove into the terrace of a cafe in the 20th arrondissement in northern Paris on Wednesday evening, leaving one dead and six injured, including three in a critical state, police said.
articles.title: Car hits Paris cafe terrace, leaving one dead and six injured

articles.author: Marine Strauss
articles.description: The late French Catholic priest Abbe Pierre, a lifelong campaigner for the homeless and the poor, has been accused of sexual assault, the charities he founded said, adding they believed the accusations and stood by the victims of abuse.
articles.title: Late French priest Abbe Pierre accused of sexual abuse, charities say

articles.author: Elizabeth Piper, Andrew Macaskill
articles.description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer will use his role as host of a European forum on Thursday to press his desire to reset Britain's post-Brexit relationship with the European Union and to reaffirm support for Ukraine.
articles.title: UK's Starmer uses European forum to press for EU reset, Ukraine support

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Secret Service Director Kimberly Cheatle has agreed to testify before the U.S. House of Representatives Oversight Committee on July 22 for a hearing related to the shooting of former President Donald Trump at a rally, the panel said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Secret Service head to testify to US congressional panel on Trump shooting

articles.author: Gram Slattery, Michael Martina, Simon Lewis
articles.description: A top national security adviser to Donald Trump said on Wednesday that Taiwan needs to boost its defense spending significantly in the face of potential Chinese aggression.
articles.title: Trump national security adviser calls on Taiwan to lift defense spending

articles.author: Ruma Paul
articles.description: Police in Bangladesh fired tear gas and rubber bullets to disperse students protesting against the government's job quota system on Wednesday, a day after violent clashes left six people dead and scores injured.
articles.title: Bangladesh shuts universities, colleges indefinitely but protests mount
